result.execSummary:
The defendant James D. Balocca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James D. Balocca is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James D. Balocca was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:16 p.m. Defendant James D. Balocca in court.  Calling 15cf192, 15cm507, 15fo1138, 16fo743. Defendant states he was released from custody on September 19, 2016 - working part-time but employer is paying for hotel where they are staying because they are homeless. Court tells defendant he must make all reasonable efforts to obtain employment that will pay him and begin monthly payments. Adj. 3:21 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for December 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

for release on furlough for birth of child - must return no later than 12 hours after birth - faxed to jail 8-1

revoked

9:02 a.m. Defendant James D. Balocca in court in custody with attorney Cana G Laska.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states record - all parties in receipt of revocation packet. Victim in court - Victim statement on sentencing. Schiek/Laska/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Jail -1 year with Huber for all purposes
Jail Credit - 51 days
Outstanding court obligations are reduced to civil judgment.
Appeal rights given. Adj. 9:25 a.m.
includes revocation summary and cover letter

2:25 p.m. Defendant James D. Balocca in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant James D. Balocca in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig states agreement. State moves to dismiss Counts 1 and 3. Defendants enters guilty plea. Plea questionaire filed. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Burns/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. Burns provides health care statement regarding Michelle Balocca. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP  2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees/Domestic Abuse Surcharge
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
No intoxicants, no taverns

to amend cash bond
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Cae called 11:48 a.m.:  Defendant James D. Balocca in court in custody.  with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Michlig statement to court - State is not prepared to go forward on Count #3 and moves to dismiss and proceed on counts 1 and 2.  Court questions Atty Burns - no objection.  Court grants motion to dismiss count #3.  Court questions Atty Burns -  Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Defendant pleads Not Guilty to both counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

3:41 p.m. Defendant James D. Balocca in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant James D. Balocca in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not reviewed with client
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 11:45 am.
